steps.title: The Junior Trap
steps.narration: Most juniors get stuck in patterns that slow their growth. They immediately start coding when given a task, fix symptoms instead of root causes, and measure progress by lines of code.

steps.title: Asking 'How?'
steps.narration: Juniors ask 'How do I do this?' first. They work in isolation, afraid to ask questions. They see AI as just a code generator. This keeps them stuck at the same level.

steps.title: The Senior Approach
steps.narration: Seniors think differently. They understand the 'why' before writing code. They ask 'What problem are we really solving?' They design systems that prevent problems from happening.

steps.title: Asking 'Why?'
steps.narration: Seniors communicate early, clarify requirements, and measure progress by impact delivered. They use AI as a thinking partner, not just a code generator. This is the mindset shift that accelerates growth.

steps.title: The Real Difference
steps.narration: Here's the secret: A junior fixes bugs. A mid-level prevents bugs. A senior designs systems where certain classes of bugs can't exist. This course teaches you to think like the third type.

steps.title: Traditional Timeline
steps.narration: The traditional path from junior to senior takes 5 to 10 years. You slowly accumulate experience, make mistakes, and eventually level up. But what if there was a shortcut?

steps.title: You Are Here
steps.narration: Right now, you're at the starting point. You might feel like senior-level thinking is years away. But with AI tools and the right approach, the timeline is about to compress dramatically.

steps.title: AI Acceleration
steps.narration: AI changes everything. Ten times faster learning. Eighty percent less time on boilerplate. You can focus on architecture and systems thinking while AI handles implementation details.

steps.title: Mid-Level: 6-12 Months
steps.narration: With deliberate practice and AI collaboration, you can reach mid-level thinking in 6 to 12 months. You start seeing patterns, understanding codebases faster, and preventing bugs proactively.

steps.title: Senior: 12-24 Months
steps.narration: By month 12 to 24, you're operating at senior level. You design systems, make architectural decisions, and lead features. The goal is to become an architect who thinks in systems.

steps.title: Not About More Code
steps.narration: Here's what nobody tells you: the skills that accelerate your growth are not about writing more code. They're about how you think. Let's look at what actually matters.

steps.title: Codebase Navigation
steps.narration: Understanding large codebases quickly is critical. Seniors can jump into million-line codebases and find what they need in hours, not weeks. We'll cover this in Chapter 1.

steps.title: Data Flow Tracing
steps.narration: Following data through systems is another critical skill. Where does data come from? Where does it go? What transforms it along the way? Chapter 2 is all about this.

steps.title: Design First
steps.narration: Planning before coding is what separates seniors from juniors. Taking 30 minutes to design can save 30 hours of rework. This becomes second nature in Chapter 4.

steps.title: AI Collaboration
steps.narration: The master skill: using AI as a thinking partner. Not just for code generation, but for exploring designs, catching blind spots, and accelerating every other skill. This runs through the entire course.

questions.question: A senior engineer is asked to add a new feature. What do they do first?
options: Open their IDE and start coding
Look for similar code to copy
Ask clarifying questions about the requirements
Estimate how long it will take
questions.explanation: Seniors understand the 'why' before writing code. They clarify requirements first because building the wrong thing perfectly is worse than building the right thing imperfectly.

questions.question: What's the key difference between how juniors and seniors measure progress?
questions.explanation: Juniors often measure progress by lines of code or tasks completed. Seniors focus on the impact their work delivers to users and the business.
